00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 problemRandomize.pl - Reseed a problem so that students can do additional versions for
00020 more practice.
00021 
00022 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00023 
00024 This file implements a mechanism for allowing a problem file to be
00025 "reseeded" so that the student can do additional versions of the
00026 problem.  You can control when the reseed message is available,
00027 and what style to use for it.
00028 
00029 To use the problemRandimize library, use
00030 
00031     loadMacros("problemRandomize.pl");
00032 
00033 at the top of your problem file, and then create a problemRandomize
00034 object with
00035 
00036     $pr = ProblemRandomize(options);
00037 
00038 where '$pr' is the name of the variable you will use to refer
00039 to the randomized problem (if needed), and 'options' can include:
00040 
00041 =over
00042 
00043 =item C<S<< when => type >>>
00044 
00045 Specifies the condition on which
00046 reseeding the problem is allowed.
00047 The choices include:
00048 
00049 =over
00050 
00051 =item *
00052 
00053 C<Correct> - only when the problem has been answered correctly.
00054 
00055 =item *
00056 
00057 C<Always> - reseeding is always allowed.
00058 
00059 =back
00060 
00061 Default: "Correct"
00062 
00063 =item C<S<< onlyAfterDue => 0 or 1 >>>
00064 
00065 Specifies if the reseed option is only
00066 allowed after the due date has passed.
00067 Default:  1
00068 
00069 =item C<S<< style => type >>>
00070 
00071 Determines the type of interaction needed
00072 to reseed the problem.  Types include:
00073 
00074 =over
00075 
00076 =item *
00077 
00078 C<Button> - a button.
00079 
00080 =item *
00081 
00082 C<Checkbox> - a checkbox plus pressing submit.
00083 
00084 =item *
00085 
00086 C<Input> - an input box where the seed can be set explicitly.
00087 
00088 =item *
00089 
00090 C<HTML> - the HTML is given explicitly via the "label" option below.
00091 
00092 =back
00093 
00094 Default:  "Button"
00095 
00096 =item C<S<< label => "text" >>>
00097 
00098 Specifies the text used for the button name,
00099 checkbox label, input box label, or raw HTML
00100 used for the reseed mechanism.
00101 
00102 =back
00103 
00104 The problemRandomize library installs a special grader that handles determining
00105 when the reseed option will be available.  It also redefines install_problem_grader
00106 so that it will not overwrite the one installed by the library (it is stored so
00107 that it can be called internally by the problemRandomize library's grader).
00108 
00109 Note that the problem will store the new problem seed only if the student can
00110 submit saved answers (i.e., only before the due date).  After the due date,
00111 the student can get new versions, but the problem will revert to the original
00112 version when they come back to the problem later.  Since the default is only
00113 to allow reseeding afer the due date, the reseeding will not be sticky by default.
00114 Hardcopy ALWAYS produces the original version of the problem, regardless of
00115 the seed saved by the student.
00116 
00117 Examples:
00118 
00119     ProblemRandomize();                               # use all defaults
00120     ProblemRandomize(when=>"Always");                 # always can reseed (after due date)
00121     ProblemRandomize(onlyAfterDue=>0);                # can reseed whenever correct
00122     ProblemRandomize(when=>"always",onlyAfterDue=>0); # always can reseed
00123     ProblemRandomize(style=>"Input");                 # use an input box to set the seed
00124 
00125 For problems that include "PGcourse.pl" in their loadMacros() calls, you can
00126 use that file to provide reseed buttons for ALL problems simply by including
00127 
00128     loadMacros("problemRandomize.pl");
00129     ProblemRandomize();
00130 
00131 in PGcourse.pl.  You can make the ProblemRandomize() be dependent on the set
00132 number or the set or the login ID or whatever.  For example
00133 
00134     loadMacros("problemRandomize.pl");
00135     ProblemRandomize(when=>"always",onlyAfterDue=>0,style=>"Input")
00136         if $studentLogin eq "dpvc";
00137 
00138 would enable reseeding at any time for the user called "dpvc" (presumably a
00139 professor).  You can test $probNum and $setNumber to make reseeding available
00140 only for specific sets or problems within a set.
00141 
00142 =cut
00143 
00144 sub _problemRandomize_init {
00145   sub ProblemRandomize {new problemRandomize(@_)}
00146   PG_restricted_eval(<<'  end_eval');
00147     sub install_problem_grader {
00148       return $main::PG->{flags}->{problemRandomize}->useGrader(@_) if $main::PG->{flags}->{problemRandomize};
00149       &{$problemRandomize::installGrader}(@_); # call cached version
00150     }
00151   end_eval
00152 }
00153 
00154 ######################################################################
00155 
00156 package problemRandomize;
00157 
00158 #
00159 #  The state data that is stored between invocations of
00160 #  the problem.
00161 #
00162 our %defaultStatus = (
00163   seed => $main::problemSeed,  # original seed
00164   answers => "",               # list of answer names
00165   ans_rule_count => 0,         # number of unnamed answers
00166 );
00167 
00168 #
00169 #  Cache original grader installer (so we can override it).
00170 #
00171 our $installGrader = \&main::install_problem_grader;
00172 
00173 #
00174 #  Create new problemRandomize object from user's data
00175 #  and initialize it.
00176 #
00177 sub new {
00178   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00179   my $pr = bless {
00180     when => "correct",
00181     onlyAfterDue => 1,
00182     style => "Button",
00183     styleName => ($main::inputs_ref->{effectiveUser} ne $main::inputs_ref->{user} ? "checkAnswers" : "submitAnswers"),
00184     label => undef,
00185     buttonLabel => "Get a new version of this problem",
00186     checkboxLabel => "Get a new version of this problem",
00187     inputLabel => "Set random seed to:",
00188     grader => $main::PG->{flags}->{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE}  || \&main::avg_problem_grader,  #$main::PG_FLAGS{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE}
00189     random => $main::PG_random_generator,
00190     status => {},
00191     @_
00192   }, $class;
00193   $pr->{style} = uc(substr($pr->{style},0,1)) . lc(substr($pr->{style},1));
00194   $pr->{when} = lc($pr->{when});
00195   $pr->getStatus;
00196   $pr->initProblem;
00197   return $pr;
00198 }
00199 
00200 #
00201 #  Look up the status from the previous invocation
00202 #  and check to see if a rerandomization is requested
00203 #
00204 sub getStatus {
00205   my $self = shift;
00206   main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL("_reseed");
00207   main::RECORD_FORM_LABEL("_status");
00208   my $label = $self->{label} || $self->{lc($self->{style})."Label"};
00209   $self->{status} = $self->decode;
00210   $self->{submit} = $main::inputs_ref->{submitAnswers};
00211   $self->{isReset} = $main::inputs_ref->{_reseed} || ($self->{submit} && $self->{submit} eq $label);
00212   $self->{isReset} = 0 unless !$self->{onlyAfterDue} || time >= $main::dueDate;
00213 }
00214 
00215 #
00216 #  Initialize the current problem
00217 #
00218 sub initProblem {
00219   my $self = shift;
00220   $main::PG->{flags}->{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE} = \&problemRandomize::grader;
00221   $main::PG->{flags}->{problemRandomize} = $self;
00222   $self->reset if $self->{isReset};
00223   $main::problemSeed = $self->{status}{seed};
00224   $self->{random}->srand($self->{status}{seed});
00225 }
00226 
00227 #
00228 #  Clear the answers and re-randomize the seed
00229 #
00230 sub reset {
00231   my $self = shift;
00232   my $status = $self->{status};
00233   foreach my $id (split(/;/,$status->{answers})) {delete $main::inputs_ref->{$id}}
00234   foreach my $id (1..$status->{ans_rule_count})
00235     {delete $main::inputs_ref->{main::ANS_NUM_TO_NAME($id)}}
00236   $main::inputs_ref->{_status} = $self->encode(\%defaultStatus);
00237   $status->{seed} = ($main::inputs_ref->{_reseed} || seed());
00238 }
00239 
00240 sub seed {substr(time,5,5)}
00241 
00242 ##################################################
00243 
00244 #
00245 #  Return the HTML for the "re-randomize" checkbox.
00246 #
00247 sub randomizeCheckbox {
00248   my $self = shift;
00249   my $label = shift || $self->{checkboxLabel};
00250   $label = "<b>$label</b> (when you submit your answers).";
00251   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? $main::PAR : '');
00252   $self->{reseedInserted} = 1;
00253   $par . '<input type="checkbox" name="_reseed" value="'.seed().'" />' . $label;
00254 }
00255 
00256 #
00257 #  Return the HTML for the "next part" button.
00258 #
00259 sub randomizeButton {
00260   my $self = shift;
00261   my $label = quoteHTML(shift || $self->{buttonLabel});
00262   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? $main::PAR : '');
00263   $par . qq!<input type="submit" name="$self->{styleName}" value="$label" !
00264        .  q!onclick="document.getElementById('_reseed').value=!.seed().'" />';
00265 }
00266 
00267 #
00268 #  Return the HTML for the "problem seed" input box
00269 #
00270 sub randomizeInput {
00271   my $self = shift;
00272   my $label = quoteHTML(shift || $self->{inputLabel});
00273   my $par = shift; $par = ($par ? main::PAR : '');
00274   $par . qq!<input type="submit" name="$self->{styleName}" value="$label" !
00275        .  q!onclick="document.getElementById('_reseed').value=document.getElementById('_seed').value" />!
00276        . qq!<input name="_seed" id="_seed" value="$self->{status}{seed}" size="10">!;
00277 }
00278 
00279 #
00280 #  Return the raw HTML provided
00281 #
00282 sub randomizeHTML {shift; shift}
00283 
00284 ##################################################
00285 
00286 #
00287 #  Encode all the status information so that it can be
00288 #  maintained as the student submits answers.  Since this
00289 #  state information includes things like the score from
00290 #  the previous parts, it is "encrypted" using a dumb
00291 #  hex encoding (making it harder for a student to recognize
00292 #  it as valuable data if they view the page source).
00293 #
00294 sub encode {
00295   my $self = shift; my $status = shift || $self->{status};
00296   my @data = (); my $data = "";
00297   foreach my $id (main::lex_sort(keys(%defaultStatus))) {push(@data, ($status->{$id}) )}
00298   foreach my $c (split(//,join('|',@data))) {$data .= toHex($c)}
00299   return $data;
00300 }
00301 
00302 #
00303 #  Decode the data and break it into the status hash.
00304 #
00305 sub decode {
00306   my $self = shift; my $status = shift || $main::inputs_ref->{_status};
00307   return {%defaultStatus} unless $status;
00308   my @data = (); foreach my $hex (split(/(..)/,$status)) {push(@data,fromHex($hex)) if $hex ne ''}
00309   @data = split('\\|',join('',@data)); $status = {%defaultStatus};
00310   foreach my $id (main::lex_sort(keys(%defaultStatus))) {$status->{$id} = shift(@data)}
00311   return $status;
00312 }
00313 
00314 
00315 #
00316 #  Hex encoding is shifted by 10 to obfuscate it further.
00317 #  (shouldn't be a problem since the status will be made of
00318 #  printable characters, so they are all above ASCII 32)
00319 #
00320 sub toHex {main::spf(ord(shift)-10,"%X")}
00321 sub fromHex {main::spf(hex(shift)+10,"%c")}
00322 
00323 
00324 #
00325 #  Make sure the data can be properly preserved within
00326 #  an HTML <INPUT TYPE="HIDDEN"> tag.
00327 #
00328 sub quoteHTML {
00329   my $string = shift;
00330   $string =~ s/&/\&amp;/g; $string =~ s/"/\&quot;/g;
00331   $string =~ s/>/\&gt;/g;  $string =~ s/</\&lt;/g;
00332   return $string;
00333 }
00334 
00335 ##################################################
00336 
00337 #
00338 #  Set the grader for this part to the specified one.
00339 #
00340 sub useGrader {
00341   my $self = shift;
00342   $self->{grader} = shift;
00343 }
00344 
00345 #
00346 #  The custom grader that does the work of computing the scores
00347 #  and saving the data.
00348 #
00349 sub grader {
00350   my $self = $main::PG->{flags}->{problemRandomize};
00351 
00352   #
00353   #  Call the original grader
00354   #
00355   $self->{grader} = \&problemRandomize::resetGrader if $self->{isReset};
00356   my ($result,$state) = &{$self->{grader}}(@_);
00357   shift; shift; my %options = @_;
00358 
00359   #
00360   #  Update that state information and encode it.
00361   #
00362   my $status = $self->{status};
00363   $status->{ans_rule_count} = main::ans_rule_count();
00364   $status->{answers} = join(';',grep(!/${main::QUIZ_PREFIX}${main::ANSWER_PREFIX}/o,keys(%{$_[0]})));
00365   my $data = quoteHTML($self->encode);
00366   $result->{type} = "problemRandomize ($result->{type})";
00367 
00368   #
00369   #  Conditions for when to show the reseed message
00370   #
00371   my $inputs = $main::inputs_ref;
00372   my $isSubmit = $inputs->{submitAnswers} || $inputs->{previewAnswers} || $inputs->{checkAnswers};
00373   my $score = ($isSubmit || $self->{isReset} ? $result->{score} : $state->{recorded_score});
00374   my $isWhen = ($self->{when} eq 'always' ||
00375      ($self->{when} eq 'correct' && $score >= 1 && !$main::inputs_ref->{previewAnswers}));
00376   my $okDate = (!$self->{onlyAfterDue} || time >= $main::dueDate);
00377 
00378   #
00379   #  Add the problemRandomize message and data
00380   #
00381   if ($isWhen && !$okDate) {
00382     $result->{msg} .= "</i><br /><b>Note:</b> <i>" if $result->{msg};
00383     $result->{msg} .= "You can get a new version of this problem after the due date.";
00384   }
00385   if (!$result->{msg}) {
00386     # hack to remove unwanted "<b>Note: </b>" from the problem
00387     #  (it is inserted automatically by Problem.pm when {msg} is non-emtpy).
00388     $result->{msg} .= '<script>var bb = document.getElementsByTagName("b");'
00389                    .  'bb[bb.length-1].style.display="none"</script>';
00390   }
00391   $result->{msg} .= qq!<input type="hidden" name="_status" value="$data" />!;
00392 
00393   #
00394   #  Include the "randomize" checkbox, button, or whatever.
00395   #
00396   if ($isWhen && $okDate) {
00397     my $method = "randomize".$self->{style};
00398     $result->{msg} .= $self->$method($self->{label},1).'<br/>';
00399   }
00400 
00401   #
00402   #  Don't show the summary section if the problem is being reset.
00403   #
00404   if ($self->{isReset} && $isSubmit) {
00405     $result->{msg} .= "<style>.problemHeader {display:none}</style>";
00406     $state->{state_summary_msg} =
00407        "<b>Note:</b> This is a new (re-randomized) version of the problem.".$main::BR.
00408        "If you come back to it later, it may revert to its original version.".$main::BR.
00409        "Hardcopy will always print the original version of the problem.";
00410   }
00411 
00412   #
00413   #  Make sure we don't go on unless the next button really is checked
00414   #
00415   $result->{msg} .= '<input type="hidden" name="_reseed" id="_reseed" value="0" />'
00416     unless $self->{reseedInserted};
00417 
00418   return ($result,$state);
00419 }
00420 
00421 #
00422 #  Fake grader for when the problem is reset
00423 #
00424 sub resetGrader {
00425   my $answers = shift;
00426   my $state = shift;
00427   my %options = @_;
00428   my $result = {
00429     score => 0,
00430     msg => '',
00431     errors => '',
00432     type => 'problemRandomize (reset)',
00433   };
00434   return ($result,$state);
00435 }
